At-a-Glance: Selling wholesale to shops demands consistent supply, clear pricing, and food-safety compliance.
Why it Matters: Expands sales beyond farmers markets and direct channels.
Requires readiness for trade buyer expectations.
Step-by-Step: 1) Prepare wholesale price list (case volumes, unit costs, margins).
2) Ensure labels and packaging meet retail legal standards.
3) Document HACCP-lite and batch traceability records.
4) Offer samples and a short producer story to buyers.
5) Plan reliable delivery or courier logistics.
Safety & Compliance: Retail-ready honey and wax products must meet UK/EU labelling and food hygiene law.
Common Pitfalls: Weak shelf presentation compared to competitors.
Further Reading: UK small food producer wholesale guides
